title: User talk:Fleetflame/Archive 1
content:
<-- [[user talk:fleetflame|Back to Talkpage]] {{Archive top}} == Horn of Africa == Hi Fleetflame youve recently labelled a post for admin assistance about the defenition of the Horn of africa as being resolved. you did this apparently without addressing the real issue which was a dispute about, the defenition of the Horn of Africa. this is an argument has dragged on for a long time, and you just labelled it as resolved without dissaproving or agreeing with any of the points. .--[[User:Liban80|Liban80]] ([[User talk:Liban80|talk]]) 15:18, 25 June 2009 (UTC) thank you for clarifying your point on the on admin assistance talk page. it was much appreciated--[[User:Liban80|Liban80]] ([[User talk:Liban80|talk]]) 12:29, 26 June 2009 (UTC) == WPMHA07 == Someone who cares more about putting things in order than being a douche did it for me. You know it doesn't say to "put it in alphabetical order" either :-p [[User:Apartcents|Apartcents]] ([[User talk:Apartcents|talk]]) 18:35, 27 November 2007 (UTC) :*It does now :)))))) Thanks for your help with the drive! Keep up the good work. --[[User:Roger Davies|'''ROGER DAVIES''']] [[User talk:Roger Davies|'''talk''']] 08:07, 1 December 2007 (UTC) ::*You might find this Firefox add-on useful: [https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/425 Linky]. It opens links in tabs on your browser. This means you can have the sub-worklist itself, plus all ten articles in it, plus their talk pages, open at once. This also saves on mouse clicks! ::*Also, don't strike through and save articles as you go. Delete the tagged ones from the list as you work through, then strike the remainder at the end before saving. You can strike the sub-worklist and preserve its autonumbering by putting the after the first # in the list. :::Good luck, --[[User:Roger Davies|'''ROGER DAVIES''']] [[User talk:Roger Davies|'''talk''']] 18:59, 4 December 2007 (UTC) :::You're doing it fine.--[[User:Roger Davies|'''ROGER DAVIES''']] [[User talk:Roger Davies|'''talk''']] 18:46, 18 December 2007 (UTC) == Thanks and Happy New Year == Firstly, let me wish you a very happy New Year and thank you for all your help in the Milhist '''Tag & Assess 2007''' drive. Secondly, although the '''Tag & Assess 2007''' drive is now officially closed, you are very welcome to continue tagging and assessing until [[31 January]] 2008. Any extra articles you tag and assess during this time will be credited fully to your tagging tally for further award purposes. Thirdly, if you can find the time, it would be great to have your feedback/comments and participation in the recently-set-up [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Drive/Workshop|'''Tag & Assess workshop''']] The idea is to see what lessons we can learn from the 2007 drive to make the 2008 one more efficient and enjoyable. Thanks again for your help, --[[User:Roger Davies|'''ROGER DAVIES''']] [[User talk:Roger Davies|'''talk''']] 10:36, 3 January 2008 (UTC) ::Thank you very much indeed for the barnstar. It was both entirely unexpected and enormously appreciated :) Thank you too, once again, for your help with the drive and your comments at the workshop! All the best, --[[User:Roger Davies|'''ROGER DAVIES''']] [[User talk:Roger Davies|'''talk''']] 07:21, 7 January 2008 (UTC) ==Barnstar== {| style="border: 1px solid {{{border|gray}}}; background-color: {{{color|#fdffe7}}};" |rowspan="2" valign="top" | [[Image:Environment Barnstar.png]] |rowspan="2" | |style="font-size: x-large; padding: 0; vertical-align: bottom; height: 1.1em;" | '''The Environmental Barnstar''' |- |style="vertical-align: top; border-top: 1px solid gray;" | Thank you, Fleetflame, for rewriting [[Environmental impacts of dams]], and for encouraging the input of other editors along the way. Well done! [[User:Johnfos|Johnfos]] ([[User talk:Johnfos|talk]]) 21:50, 15 January 2008 (UTC) |} ==God vs god== Copied from [[User Talk:J.delanoy|J.delanoy's talk page]]--Why did you make [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Prayer&curid=25042&diff=185095898&oldid=185095866 this change]? If you will do a case-sensitive search throughout this article, you will find that every time the word "God" is used, it refers to a certain deity specific to the religion in subject. If the word refers to "''a'' god," as in this case, it should be lowercase. I'm leaving it alone for the time being, but if you have no objections, it should be changed back to "god." '''Fléêťflämẽ''' [[User:Fleetflame|U]]-[[User_talk:Fleetflame|T]]-[[Special:Contributions/Fleetflame|C]] 01:58, 18 January 2008 (UTC) :Well, you're right, there is an inconsistancy in the [[prayer]] article, with God being approx, 60% vs god with approx 40%. In my opinion, this is not very strong in either direction, so I will add a thing on the [[Talk:Prayer|talk page]] to see which people think is better, as we should probably use on or the other. Thanks for bringing it to my attention, and I apologize for any problems that may have happened because of my edits. [[User:J.delanoy|J.delanoy]][[User Talk:J.delanoy|gabs]][[Special:Contributions/J.delanoy|adds]] 12:30, 18 January 2008 (UTC) ::My question was not about the different capitalizations ([[Talk:Prayer|see here]]) but rather why you changed the capitalization in a noun phrase, (e.g. you changed "a god" to "a God." If the statement refers to a specific god, it should say "God," and if not, as in this same sentence, it should be lowercase. '''Fléêťflämẽ''' [[User:Fleetflame|U]]-[[User_talk:Fleetflame|T]]-[[Special:Contributions/Fleetflame|C]] 03:15, 19 January 2008 (UTC) :::Well, I saw the note you made in Prayer's talk page, and I think you're right, it makes no difference to me what you do. When I made the original change, I had just started patrolling recent changes, and I was a little careless. Sorry. [[User:J.delanoy|J.delanoy]][[User Talk:J.delanoy|gabs]][[Special:Contributions/J.delanoy|adds]] 02:44, 20 January 2008 (UTC) ::::No, I'm not saying that you did something wrong, it's just that there's no inconsistency there. Those words are supposed to be capitalized the way they are. Thanks for understanding :-) '''Fléêťflämẽ''' [[User:Fleetflame|U]]-[[User_talk:Fleetflame|T]]-[[Special:Contributions/Fleetflame|C]] 01:05, 21 January 2008 (UTC) == Regarding [[Wikipedia:Editor Review]] == Sorry, but I have removed your editor review on the basis that you are a wholly inexperienced editor, based upon your minute [http://tools.wikimedia.de/~interiot/cgi-bin/Tool1/wannabe_kate?username=Fleetflame&site=en.wikipedia.org edit counter] and inexperience with editing a wide range of Wikipedia articles. A reviewer of other editors must take careful consideration of their prior edits, not including ones in an Edit Counter, and careful analysis must be made of their prior contributions -- especially if the editor has specifically requested it. With that said, I have over ''11,000'' edits, and have contributed to hundreds of articles, not just to [[University of Kentucky]] and [[Pullman Square]] as you indicated. I am also a participant at the [[WP:MC|Mediation Committee]], [[WP:WQA|Wikiquette Alerts]], and at [[WP:3O|Third Opinion]], among other noticeboards, and all of those were severely overlooked as well. [[Environmental issues with the Three Gorges Dam]] has recently been spun off from [[Three Gorges Dam]] and it seems editors have got caught up with the negative aspects again, ignoring some positive environmental benefits of dams. Would you care to take a look at it please, with NPOV in mind... thanks, [[User:Johnfos|Johnfos]] ([[User talk:Johnfos|talk]]) 06:11, 26 February 2008 (UTC) == Writing for the ''Signpost'' == Hello. You expressed interest in writing for the [[WP:POST|''Wikipedia Signpost'']] (sorry for the delay in responding). I'm sending this message to everyone who commented, so if you have any questions I haven't answered, please feel free to [[User talk:Ral315|ask me]], and I'll try to respond to specific questions. Essentially, what I'm looking for is writers who can step in and write on subjects that are newsworthy from week-to-week. The content of the stories obviously varies each week depending on what's happening; this is discussed below. There are three major parts to writing an article: # Choosing a topic # Writing the article # Submitting the article === Part 1: Choosing a topic === As said above, topics will vary from week-to-week. For this week, these particular issues may be newsworthy: * '''Bureaucratship candidacies''' — There are a lot of bureaucratship candidacies this week, for the first time in about six or seven months. I'm personally covering this one for next week, but this is a good example of what might be newsworthy. * '''Encyclopedia of Life''' — This encyclopedia of species has been getting some press, and relates somewhat to Wikimedia project [[Wikispecies]]. * '''Hidden categories''' — For those technically inclined, this is a new feature that has some interesting implications. For more ideas, and for ideas in the future, check [[WP:POST/N/S|the tip-line]] -- there are usually some good ideas there. Once you've decided on a topic, make sure to sign up for it [[WP:POST/N/O|in the newsroom]], under "Special stories", so that users aren't duplicating each others' work (though multiple writers are certainly free to work together on a story). === Part 2: Writing the article === Now, you've decided on a topic and signed up for it. To write it, create a subpage in your userspace. For my story this week on the bureaucratship candidacies, for example, I'll create it at [[User:Ral315/Bureaucratship candidacies]]. The name isn't a big deal, of course -- I'll change it if necessary. Formatting the story isn't important; for your first article, you should mainly focus on writing a good story, and I'll take care of the formatting when we publish. Try to write it in a newspaper-like tone, avoiding personal comments and opinions in favor of straight-forward facts. The size of an article varies based on what the story is, but a good minimum goal for ''most stories'' is two-to-three good paragraphs. Longer articles are even better, so long as they're well-written. === Part 3: Submitting the article === Now, all you have to do is post a link to the article [[WP:POST/N/O|in the newsroom]], where you signed up for it earlier. That's it! You're done! Again, if you have any questions at all, please contact me, and I'll try to respond as soon as possible. Thanks for your interest in writing for the ''Signpost''.  |- |} == Lake Buena Vista and Wide World of Sports == [http://www.rcid.org/PDF/political%20jurisdiction%20map.base05_11.pdf This PDF map] of the Reedy Creek Improvement District is one of the best maps of Disney's property that I have found (actually, another contributor found it). It clearly shows that WWoS is in Osceola County and not Orange County. '''IF''' WWoS was in Orange County, then it would have to be in Bay Lake since it is west of Bonnet Creek. I don't mean to make a big deal about it; I'm just trying to make the article consistant. Wide World of Sports (and the rest of Disney's property) does use Lake Buena Vista as a mailing address, but most of the property is not physically within Lake Buena Vista. There has actually been quite a lot of discussion on the various WDW pages regarding its location. See [[WP:MUSIC#Songs|this paragraph]] for more detailed information on the subject. Singles are generally not considered notable enough to have their own articles on Wikipedia; thus they are usually redirected to the album's article, or if that does not exist, they may redirect to the band. The exceptions are songs that have won major awards or have enjoyed significant chart rankings. This song appears to be neither. I hope this clears up the confusion. Feel free to ask me any other questions. If you know of another interesting fact from a recently created article, then please suggest it on the [[:Template talk:Did you know|Did you know? talk page]]. |} [[User:BorgQueen|BorgQueen]] ([[User talk:BorgQueen|talk]]) 18:07, 25 July 2009 (UTC) {{Wikipedia:Spotlight/needhelp}} == DYK for Santalum austrocaledonicum == {| class="messagebox standard-talk" |- |[[Image:Updated DYK query.svg|15px|Updated DYK query]] |On [[Wikipedia:Recent_additions#August 25 2009|August 25, 2009]], '''[[:Template:Did you know|Did you know?]]''' was updated with a fact from the article '''''[[Santalum austrocaledonicum]]''''', which you created or substantially expanded. Once I have some semblance of the article up, is there someway that I could give you access to the page before it is up so that you could check it out and give me any further tips? ˜˜˜ —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Delahaye9999|Delahaye9999]] ([[User talk:Delahaye9999|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Delahaye9999|contribs]]) 19:12, 1 September 2009 (UTC) :Yes. Instead of creating the page (for example) [[Delahaye9999 is awesome]], instead create it at [[user:Delahaye9999/article]]. We call this a [[WP:USERSUBPAGE|user subpage]] - you can work on the article here at your leisure with much less risk of it being deleted, etc. When you put it there, let me know and I can take a look. '''[[User Talk:Fleetflame|Fleetflame]]''' 21:11, 1 September 2009 (UTC) == DYK for Election Commission of Nepal == {| class="messagebox standard-talk" |- |[[Image:Updated DYK query.svg|15px|Updated DYK query]] |On [[Wikipedia:Recent_additions#September 7 2009|September 7, 2009]], '''[[:Template:Did you know|Did you know?]]''' was updated with a fact from the article '''''[[Election Commission of Nepal]]''''', which you created or substantially expanded. If you know of another interesting fact from a recently created article, then please suggest it on the [[:Template talk:Did you know|Did you know? talk page]]. |} ≈ [[User:Chamal_N|'''C'''hamal]] [[User talk:Chamal_N|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Chamal_N|¤]] 17:23, 7 September 2009 (UTC) == Whaling station on Lifou? == Hi. I saw that you put on the Lifou article that a whaling station was established there in 1860. I dealt with this piece of information before, and no one has provided a primary source that shows there ever was a whaling station there. As I said earlier when I had dealt with this issue, a travel guide that doesn't provide a primary source ''isn't'' a reliable source. I will be removing said information from the article until you (or someone else) provides a primary source that proves there was a station there. [[User:Jonas Poole|Jonas Poole]] ([[User talk:Jonas Poole|talk]]) 00:44, 17 September 2009 (UTC) == Possibly unfree File:Mark-Whitacre-2008.jpg == A file that you uploaded or altered, [[:File:Mark-Whitacre-2008.jpg]], has been listed at [[Wikipedia:Possibly unfree files]] because its copyright status is unclear or disputed. If the file's copyright status cannot be verified, it may be deleted. You may find more information on the [[:File:Mark-Whitacre-2008.jpg|file description page]]. You are welcome to add comments to its entry at [[Wikipedia:Possibly unfree files/2009 September 20#File:Mark-Whitacre-2008.jpg|the discussion]] if you are interested in it not being deleted. Thank you. --'''[[User:Cirt|Cirt]]''' ([[User talk:Cirt|talk]]) 17:13, 20 September 2009 (UTC) == Possible DYK? == Hi hi, as requested, I've expanded [[rouge test]] a bit. Think it's ready? [[User:JoeSmack|JoeSmack]] [[User Talk:JoeSmack|Talk]] 23:40, 11 October 2009 (UTC) == Spotlight Newsletter - October == {| class="navbox collapsible uncollapsed" style="text-align: left; width: 80%;" |- ! colspan="2" style="background: #ffffff; border: 1px gray solid; padding: 0.2em; text-align: center;" | '''The [[Wikipedia:Spotlight|Spotlight]] [[Wikipedia:Spotlight/Newsletter|Newsletter]]''', Issue III : October 2009 |- ! colspan="2" style="border: 1px #aaaaaa solid; font-family: georgia, palatino, palatino linotype, times, times new roman, serif; padding: 0.5em;" |
Join the collaboration, in the [irc://irc.freenode.net/wikipedia-spotlight IRC chat room]!
|- | colspan="1" style="border: 1px #aaaaaa solid;" |'''Wikiproject'''
After great success with [[Marco Polo]] (and [[Marco Polo sheep|his sheep!]]), [[Dry ice]] went pretty well. [[USS Massachusetts (BB-59)]] was challenging, and with [[Monkey]], the project faded: [[Battle of the Nobles]] and [[Oil]] got little attention. | colspan="1" style="border: 1px #aaaaaa solid;" |'''We need your help!''' Spotlight is a collaboration - it works really well when lots of people get involved. It doesn't matter what skills you bring, because between us, we can do great things. Even if you make one, simple edit - if 100 people do that, we'll have made significant progress, and we all benefit by learning from each other. |- | colspan="1" style="border: 1px #aaaaaa solid;" |'''Current article'''
This time, we've created a brand-new article, and between us we're confident of achieving a [[WP:DYK|'''''Did you know...''']] on the main page, and work towards getting the article rated as C-class or B-class.
| colspan="1" style="border: 1px #aaaaaa solid;" |'''Father [[Aengus Finucane]]''' died on 6 October at the age of 77; he was an Irish priest who did lots of work helping refugees of world conflicts, and was the head of the charity [[Concern Worldwide|Concern]]. There are plenty of reliable sources, so it should be easy to write this - so ''please help out by editing the article''.
{{Find sources|Aengus Finucane}}
|- ! colspan="2" |'''
Stop press: [[Aengus Finucane]] just appeared on the main page
''' |- ! colspan="2" valign="top" style="border: 1px #aaaaaa solid; font-family: georgia, palatino, palatino linotype, times, times new roman, serif; font-size: 85%; padding: 0.5em; text-align: center;" | [[Wikipedia:Spotlight|Home]] · [[{{wikipedia:Spotlight/Current/Page}}|Current Article]] · [[{{Wikipedia:Spotlight/Current/Next}}|Next Article]] · [[Wikipedia:Spotlight/Newsletter/Spamlist|Change Subscription]] · [[Wikipedia:Spotlight/Newsletter/Spamlist/Fulltext|Unsubscribe]] |} == DYK Siege of Atorga, Irisk Legion == [[Image:Symbol question.svg|25px]] Hello! Your submission of [[Irish Legion]] at the [[Template talk:DYK|Did You Know nominations page]] has been reviewed, and there still are some issues that may need to be clarified. '''''John Safran vs God''''' is an eight-part [[television]] [[documentary film|documentary]] series by [[John Safran]] which was broadcast on [[SBS (Australian TV channel)|SBS TV]] of [[Australia]] in 2004. It has been described in a media release as "John Safran's most audacious project yet". It had a much more serious tone than Safran's previous work ''[[Music Jamboree]]''. The show was released by Ghost of Your Ex-Boyfriend Productions and [[SBS Independent]], was co-written with Mark O'Toole, directed by [[Craig Melville]], and produced by [[Richard Lowenstein]], [[Selin Yaman]] and [[Ghost Pictures]]. The production team was known as Ghost of Your Ex-Boyfriend Productions, an amalgamation of John Safran's Ex-Boyfriend Productions, and Richard Lowenstein's Ghost Productions. The series won the 2005 [[Australian Film Institute Awards|Australian Film Institute Award]] for Best Comedy Series.

The show's opening theme is ''Hate Priest'' by the band [[Mozart on Crack]]. The opening sequence features John in a black suit breaking out of a patch of black scorched earth with his bare hands during a thunderstorm. The words "when the thousand years are over Satan will be released from his prison" are spoken in a low pseudo-ominous voice.

== Episode guide ==          <!--each episode had a one word title - akin to "Forgiveness", "Meditation", hence the '-' scattered in titles-->

=== Episode one ===
* In the [[United Kingdom|UK]], Safran meets [[Sheikh Omar Bakri]] and [[Sheikh Abu Hamza]] and succeeds in getting a [[fatwa]] placed on [[Rove McManus]] for dropping John's scheduled appearance on [[Rove (TV series)|Rove Live]].  The fatwa was later removed from McManus.
* Safran tries out a religion based on hallucinogenic cactus plant, [[Peyote]]; [[vomiting]] and weak [[hallucination]]s ensue
* Safran examines [[Scientology]] at the expense of [[Jamie Packer]] and the [[Nine Network]]

=== Episode two ===
* Safran looks at the duplicity of Australia's "[[National Sorry Day|Sorry]]" attitude to [[Australian Aborigine|Indigenous Rights]]
* Safran tries out [[zen Buddhism]] in [[Japan]], the segment includes two incidents of Safran being beaten with a stick as punishment for mistakes made with meditation and philosophical questions
* Safran examines the link between [[Satanism]] and [[Freemasons|Freemasonry]]

=== Episode three ===
* Despite being [[Judaism|Jewish]], Safran attempts to join a branch of the [[Ku Klux Klan]] in [[California]]
* Safran tries out [[Catholic]]ism under the guidance of [[Father Bob Maguire]]
* Safran holds a competition in which Australian-[[Palestinians]] vie for his [[Israel]]i citizenship by recreating segments from ''Music Jamboree''

=== Episode four ===
* Safran examines [[LDS cinema|Mormon cinema]] in [[Salt Lake City]], proposing his "Extreme Mormons" film
* Safran tries out [[Haitian Vodou|Vodou]] in [[Haiti]], participating in the "[[Day of the Dead]]" ceremony
* John visits a [[Jews for the Preservation of Firearms Ownership|Jewish gun advocate]] and [[rabbi]] in [[Los Angeles]], in a bid to show that [[Gun politics in the US|American gun rights activists]] consist of more than [[Christian fundamentalism|fundamentalist Christians]]

The Vodou segment was graphic, featuring the TV crew being attacked, [[spiritual possession]], and a goat having its [[testicles]] bitten off and its throat slit.

=== Episode five ===
* John travels to [[Sicily]] to confess to a [[priest]] that he stole some batteries and [[masturbation|masturbated]] in a bed owned by the priest during ''[[Race Around the World]]''
* Again in Salt Lake City, Safran tries some [[atheism|atheistic]] door knocking to harass local Mormons
* In [[India]], Safran tries out the spiritual teachings of several [[Hindu]] [[guru]]s

=== Episode six ===
* John [[audition]]s for the [[Harlem Gospel Choir]] with a tuneless rendition of [[Amazing Grace]]
* John tries out [[Ásatrú in the United States|Ásatrú]] ("the [[Viking]] [[religion]]") taking part in a remembrance ceremony in the [[United States]]
* [[Big Brother (Australian TV series)|Big Brother]] series one contestant [[Sara-Marie Fedele]] helps Safran attempt to broker [[peace]] between Australian representatives of both sides of the [[Israeli-Palestinian conflict]].
* Inspired by [[rumour]]s in [[Malawi]] John confronts [[:Category:Australian politicians|Australian politicians]] in [[Canberra]] to try and discover if any are [[vampire]]s

The only politician who was found to be a so-called "vampire" was [[Kevin Rudd]] who would later become [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]].

=== Episode seven ===
* John travels to [[Mozambique]] to lift a curse from the [[Australia national football team|Socceroos]] at the behest of [[association football|football]] legend [[Johnny Warren]]
* Again in Salt Lake City, Safran finds out what is so special about "[[Temple garment (Mormonism)|Mormon underwear]]"
* With the help of [[Canberra]] [[mathematician]] [[Brendan McKay]], John uncovers the link between ''[[The Bible Code]]'', [[September 11, 2001]] and [[rapping|rapper]] [[Vanilla Ice]]
* John examines the realistic goals of religious [[boycott]]s

=== Episode eight ===
The eighth episode was the most controversial. Instead of its usual format of various segments, the show featured a single story: the [[exorcism]] of John's [[demon]]s by [[Christian]] exorcist and fundamentalist [[preacher]] [[Bob Larson]]. There was none of the humour that characterised the preceding episodes. The exorcism was dramatic and realistic and no explanation was given at the end of the episode as to John's behaviour. On the [[Yahoo!]] "[http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Cult_of_Safran/ Cult of Safran]" web group a stormy discussion started on whether John was actually faking - Safran's lisp is absent while allegedly possessed. Safran appeared in several [[radio]] and [[television]] plug spots for the show post-production/pre-screening and only briefly commented on the exorcism episode as a very intense segment to film. After the screening of the episode Safran appeared in an interview on [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation|ABC]] radio and said he didn't remember a lot of the experience. The sales pitch for the recently released DVD is "you've seen the exorcism, now buy the DVD".

The '''Pedernales River''' ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|p|ɜr|d|ə|ˈ|n|æ|l|ɨ|s}} {{respell|PUR|də|NAL|iss}}) is a tributary of the [[Colorado River (Texas)|Colorado River]], approximately {{convert|106|mi|km|0}} long, in central [[Texas]] in the [[United States]]. It drains an area of the [[Edwards Plateau]], flowing west to east across the [[Texas Hill Country]] west of [[Austin, Texas|Austin]]. The name "Pedernales", first used in the middle 18th century, comes from a [[Spanish language|Spanish]] word for the [[flint]] rocks characteristic of the riverbed.

==Description==
The river rises from springs in southeastern [[Kimble County, Texas|Kimble County]], approximately {{convert|25|mi|km|0}} southeast of [[Junction, Texas|Junction]].  It flows generally east into [[Gillespie County, Texas|Gillespie County]], past [[Fredericksburg, Texas|Fredericksburg]], and into [[Blanco County, Texas|Blanco County]], passing north of [[Johnson City, Texas|Johnson City]]. It joins the Colorado from the southwest in [[Lake Travis]], approximately {{convert|10|mi|km|0}} west of Austin.

The river has a close association with the Texas Hill Country, tied to the history of the region and emblematic of its geography. Along its route it flows over numerous rugged [[limestone]] escarpments as it winds eastward, passing along the south side of the ranch of President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]],<ref>http://www.nps.gov/lyjo/planyourvisit/upload/Locator2008-nobus.pdf</ref> who grew up in nearby [[Stonewall, Texas|Stonewall]], south of the river.

In 1750, [[Fray Benito Fernández de Santa Ana]] proposed a plan to the [[Spain|Spanish]] government that a mission be established among the [[Lipan Apache people|Lipan Apache]] who lived along the river. In 1789, the river was the site of a skirmish between Colonel [[Francisco Xavier Ugalde]] and a group of Lipan and [[Mescalero]] Indians. The first permanent white settlement along the river was in 1846, when the town of Fredericksburg was established by [[Germany|German]] immigrants. The threat of raids from Apaches restricted settlement in the area until the 1880s.

[[Pedernales Falls State Park]] is located along the river in Blanco County east of Johnson City. Like many rivers in central Texas, it is prone to variable water levels. A sign at the state park shows a relatively tranquil river in one picture and a raging wall of muddy water in the next picture, said to be taken only five minutes after the first. The speed at which [[flash floods]] can arise along this river has resulted in several deaths at the park, and warning sirens have been installed in the park and elsewhere along the river. The lower river is a popular destination for [[whitewater rafting]] during the high-water season.

==See also==

==Factual inaccuracy==

First, the article is inaccurate because it confuses from the news sources it cites the actions of other trade unions (notably the [[Federation of Oil Unions in Iraq]]) with those of the IFTU. Also, it doesn't note that IFTU no longer even uses the same name – it now goes by the General Federation of Iraqi Workers after merger with several other unions. (The article title should be changed to reflect this.) I believe this has been the case since 2005, making this article highly outdated. I'll clean this up at some point, but I don't know when that will be, so if somebody wants to take care of it sooner, by all means, go for it. [[User:Peter G Werner|Peter G Werner]] ([[User talk:Peter G Werner|talk]]) 23:53, 20 June 2009 (UTC)

{{refimprove|date=September 2014}} {{outdated|date=November 2015}} '''''Survivor BG''''' is the [[Bulgaria]]n version of the [[reality show]] ''[[Survivor (TV series)|Survivor]]'', broadcast and produced by [[BTV (Bulgaria)|bTV]]. == Seasons == {| class="wikitable" width="70%" style="text-align:left" |- ! style="padding: 0px 4px" colspan="2"| Season ! style="right: 0px 8px"| Name ! style="padding: 0px 8px"| TV Channel ! style="padding: 0px 8px"| Year ! style="padding: 0px 5px"| Days ! style="padding: 0px 35px"| Premiere ! style="padding: 0px 35px"| Final ! style="padding: 0px 30px"| Winner ! style="padding: 0px 15px"| Prize |- | height="10" bgcolor="pinkblue" | |1 |Survivor BG |[[BTV (Bulgaria)|bTV]] |2006 |57 |20 September 2006 |11 December 2006 |Neli Ivanova |250 000 [[Bulgarian lev|leva]] |- | height="10" bgcolor="pinkblue" | |2 |[[Survivor BG: Expedition Robinson|Survivor: Expedition Robinson]] |bTV |2007 |52 |19 September 2007 |6 December 2007 |Georgi Kostadinov |250 000 [[Bulgarian lev|leva]] |- | height="10" bgcolor="pinkblue" | |3 |Survivor: Islands of pearls |bTV |2008 |52 |24 September 2008 |21 December 2008 |Nikolay Martinov |250 000 [[Bulgarian lev|leva]] |- | height="10" bgcolor="pinkblue" | |4 |[[Survivor Bulgaria 4|Survivor: Philippines]] |bTV |2009 |52 |22 September 2009 |21 December 2009 |Georgi Kehayov |250 000 [[Bulgarian lev|leva]] |- | height="10" bgcolor="pinkblue" | |5 |Survivor: Cambodia |bTV |2014 |52 |15 September 2014 |15 December 2014 |[[Vanja Džaferović]] |100 000 [[Bulgarian lev|leva]] |} ==Season 1== [[Image:Survivor BG logo.png|right|thumb|200px|''Survivor BG'''s first season logo. The tagline means "Only one person will survive in the end."]] The show's first season was filmed on a deserted island in the [[Caribbean]] off the coast of the [[Dominican Republic]] in the summer of 2006 by an international Bulgarian-[[Argentina|Argentine]] team. [[Slavi Trifonov]]'s Seven/Eight Productions was a Creative Producer of the first season of the show; PromoFilm - Argentina and bTV Production Team. Local Producer in Dominican Republic, Gary Hurtado. The first season was hosted by the famous actor [[Kamen Vodenicharov]]. The show started on 20 September 2006 and ended on 11 December 2006. 16 Bulgarians (8 women and 8 men) took part in the first season. The prize was 250,000 [[Bulgarian lev|leva]] (about [[euro|€]]125,000). The first winner in Survivor BG was Neli Ivanova. title: User talk:ClydeChristopher
content: ==[[Wikipedia:Welcome, newcomers|Welcome]] to the [[Wikipedia]]== Welcome, {{PAGENAME}}! Here are some useful tips to ease you into the Wikipedia experience: * First, take a look at the [[Wikipedia:Tutorial|Wikipedia Tutorial]], and perhaps dabble a bit in the [[Wikipedia:Test area|test area]]. * When you have some free time, take a look at the [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] and [[Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines|Policies and Guidelines]]. They can come in very handy! * Learn about some of the Wikipedia landmarks by trying our [[Wikipedia:Scavenger hunt|Wikipedia scavenger hunt]]! * If you need any [[Wikipedia:Help|help]], feel free to post a question at the [[Wikipedia:Help desk|Help Desk]] * Wikipedia has a vibrant community of editors. The [[Wikipedia:Village pump|village pump]] is a great place to see the goings on. * Remember to use a [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|neutral point of view]]! * Explore, [[Wikipedia:Be bold in updating pages|be bold in editing pages]], and, most importantly, have fun! Also, here are some odds and ends that I find useful from time to time: *[[Wikipedia:Five pillars]] *[[Wikipedia:Policy trifecta]] *[[Wikipedia:Brilliant prose]] *[[Wikipedia:Be bold in updating pages]] *[[Wikipedia:Bad jokes and other deleted nonsense]] Feel free to ask me anything the links and talk pages don't answer. You can most easily reach me by posting on [[User_talk:ClockworkSoul|my talk page]]. You can sign your name on any page by typing 4 tildes, likes this: ~~~~. Best of luck, and have fun! – [[User:ClockworkSoul|Clockwork]][[User_talk:ClockworkSoul|Soul]] 13:58, 12 March 2006 (UTC)

title: Trishina
content:
{{D&D Deity|
image=|
bgcolor=#000|
fgcolor=#fff|
name=Trishina|
title=|
home=Wanders|
power=Lesser|
alignment=[[Alignment (Dungeons & Dragons)#Lawful Good|Lawful Good]]|
portfolio=Love, fidelity, the young, play|
domains=|
alias=|
super=|
}}

In many [[campaign setting]]s for the ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'' [[role-playing game]], '''Trishina''' is the [[dolphin]] deity of love, fidelity, the young, and play. Her symbol is a dolphin with a calf.

==Publication history==
Trishina was first detailed in the book ''[[Monster Mythology]]'' (1992), including details about her priesthood.<ref>[[Carl Sargent|Sargent, Carl]]. ''[[Monster Mythology]]'' (TSR, 1992)</ref>

==Description==
Trishina appears, variously, as a female dolphin or as a pretty young [[Elf (Dungeons & Dragons)|aquatic elf]]. She uses direct telepathic communications to her priests rather than relying on obscure omens.

==Relationships==
Trishina is usually depicted as the consort of [[Deep Sashelas]], and thus an honorary member of the [[Seldarine]]. She is also a member of the [[asathalfinare]].

Trishina works closely with her consort.

==Realm==
Trishina divides most of her time between [[Elysium (Dungeons & Dragons)|Elysium]] and the [[Mount Celestia|Seven Heavens]]. She has a region in the oceanic fourth layer of Elysium, Thalasia, that she sets aside for the spirits of dolphins who have died defending their young.

Trishina's husband Deep Sashelas dwells on the plane of [[Arborea (Dungeons & Dragons)|Arborea]], in the realm of ''Elavandor'', but this is not listed as one of Trishina's abodes.

==Dogma==
Trishina is more pacifistic than Deep Sashelas, more inclined to help those in need, and more convinced that redemption is possible for those of evil ilk. She will send avatars to help and heal dolphins or sea elves in peril. Sometimes she will even aid shipwrecked humans.

Because of Trishina's ties to Deep Sashelas, dolphins will aid sea elves in their wars against the [[koalinth]]s.

==Worshippers==
Trishina is worshipped by dolphins and [[Elf (Dungeons & Dragons)|aquatic elves]].

===Clergy===
Priests of Trishina are pacifists unless they need to fight in order to protect their young. In such cases, they fight fiercely and will willingly give their lives. Trishina's clerics must aid dolphins, sea elves, or other non-evil creatures in distress. Older priests are always held in respect.

==References==

title: Eastern fence lizard
content:
{{Taxobox | name = Eastern fence lizard| image = Lizzard_1_Shawnee_NP.jpg | status = LC | status_system = iucn3.1 | status_ref = {{IUCN2012.2|assessors=Hammerson, G.A., Lavin, P., Vazquez Díaz, J., Quintero Díaz, G. & Gadsden, H.|year=2007|id=64156|title=Sceloporus undulatus|downloaded=27 March 2013}} Database entry includes justification for why this species is of least concern | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | subphylum = [[Vertebrata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | subordo = [[Iguania]] | familia = [[Phrynosomatidae]] | genus = ''[[Sceloporus]]'' | species_group = ''S. undulatus'' | species = '''''S. undulatus''''' | binomial = ''Sceloporus undulatus'' | binomial_authority = ([[Louis Augustin Guillaume Bosc|Bosc]] & [[François Marie Daudin|Daudin]], 1801)Bosc and Daudin (1802) ''In Sonnini and Latreille''.Hist. Nat. Rept., Vol. 2, p. 40 | synonyms = *''Stellio undulatus'' [[Louis Augustin Guillaume Bosc|Bosc]] & [[François Marie Daudin|Daudin]], 1801 *''Lacerta undulata'' – [[Louis Augustin Guillaume Bosc|Bosc]], 1801 *''Agama undulata'' – [[François Marie Daudin|Daudin]], 1802 *''Tropidolepis undulatus''
– [[André Marie Constant Duméril|A.M.C. Duméril]] & [[Gabriel Bibron|Bibron]], 1837 *''Sceloporus undulatus''
– [[George Albert Boulenger|Boulenger]], 1885 | range_map = Sceloporus undulatus distribution.svg | range_map_caption = The ranges of different ''S. undulatus'' subspecies are indicated by color. }} [[File:Douthat State Park - Eastern fence lizard - 11.jpg|thumb|upright|Male with blue sides]] [[File:Eastern Fence Lizard on Tree.jpg|thumb|upright|Camouflaged by tree]] The '''eastern fence lizard''' (''Sceloporus undulatus'') is a medium-sized [[species]] of [[lizard]] found along [[forest]] edges, rock piles, and rotting logs or stumps in the eastern United States. It is sometimes referred to as the '''prairie lizard''', '''fence swift''', '''gray lizard''', '''northern fence lizard''' or '''pine lizard'''.http://mdc.mo.gov/discover-nature/outdoor-recreation/nature-viewing/amphibians-and-reptiles/lizards It is also referred to colloquially as the horn-billed lizard. ==Taxonomy== The [[Genera|generic]] name, ''Sceloporus'', is derived from the [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] ''skelos''/σκελος, meaning "leg", and the Latin ''porus'', meaning "hole", referring to the enlarged [[femoral pore]]s found in this [[genus]] of lizards. The specific name, ''undulatus'', is Latin for "wave", referring to the transverse dark crossbars on the backs of these lizards.Liddell & Scott (1980). Greek-English Lexicon, Abridged Edition. Oxford University Press, Oxford, UK. ISBN 0-19-910207-4 Until 2002, 10 [[subspecies]] of ''S. undulatus'' were recognized:,''S. u. consobrinus'', ''S. u. cowlesi'', ''S. u. elongatus'', ''S. u. erythrocheilus'', ''S. u. garmani'', ''S. u. hyacinthinus'', ''S. u. speari'', ''S. u. tedbrowni'', ''S. u. tristichus'', and ''S. u. undulatus''. but re-evaluation showed [[paraphyly]] between the subspecies. These were reclassified as four distinct evolutionary [[species]] (the three new species being ''[[Sceloporus consobrinus|S. consobrinus]]'', ''[[Sceloporus tristichus|S. tristichus]]'', and ''[[Sceloporus cowlesi|S. cowlesi]]''). The narrowed redefinition of ''S. undulatus'' has been suggested to still contain two subspecies divided by the [[Appalachian Mountains]]. None is currently formally recognized.{{cite journal|author=[[Adam D. Leache|Leache, A.D.]], [[Tod W. Reeder|Reeder, T.W.]]|title=Molecular systematics of the eastern fence lizard (''Sceloporus undulatus''): A comparison of parsimony, likelihood, and Bayesian approaches|journal=[[Systematic Biology|Syst. Biol.]]|volume=51|issue=1|pages=44–68|year=2002}} The following cladogram is based on Leache and Reeder, 2002: {{clade |1={{clade |1={{clade |label1=''Sceloporus undulatus'' [[species group]] |1={{clade |1={{clade |1=''[[Sceloporus cowlesi|S. cowlesi]]'' |2=''[[Sceloporus cautus|S. cautus]]'' }} |2={{clade |1={{clade |1=''[[Sceloporus tristichus|S. tristichus]]'' |2={{clade |1=''[[Sceloporus consobrinus|S. consobrinus]]'' |2=''[[Sceloporus woodi|S. woodi]]'' }} }} |2='''''S. undulatus''''' }} }} |2=''[[Sceloporus virgatus|S. virgatus]]'' }} |2=''[[Sceloporus occidentalis|S. occidentalis]]'' }} }} ==Distribution== The eastern fence lizard is found in [[Alabama]], [[Arkansas]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], [[North Carolina]], [[South Carolina]], [[Virginia]], [[Kentucky]], [[Southern Illinois]], [[Southern Indiana]], [[Tennessee]], [[Ohio]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[Maryland]], [[Missouri]], [[West Virginia]], [[Mississippi]], [[Delaware]], northern [[Florida]], and southern [[New Jersey]]. There are isolated populations outside this range in southeastern [[New York]].{{cite book | last =Conant | first =Roger | last2 =Collins | first2 =Joseph |authorlink=Roger Conant (herpetologist) | title =A Field Guide to Reptiles and Amphibians Eastern/Central North America | publisher =Houghton Mifflin Company | year= 1991 | location =[[Boston, Massachusetts]] | isbn = 0-395-58389-6 }} ==Description== The eastern fence lizard can grow from 4.0 to 7.2 inches long. It is typically colored in shades of gray or brown, and has [[Keeled scales|keeled]] [[scale (zoology)|scales]], with a dark line running along the rear of the thigh. A female is usually gray and has a series of dark, wavy lines across her back. The belly is white with black flecks, with some pale blue on the throat and belly. The male is usually brown, and during the summer, has a more greenish-blue and black coloration on the sides of the belly and throat than the female has. The young look like the females, but are darker and duller. They closely resemble the [[western fence lizard]], but differ slightly in coloration and live in a different area and habitat. ==Response to fire ant predation== In 70 years, according to a study published in 2009, eastern fence lizards in parts of the United States have adapted to have longer legs and new behaviors to escape the [[red imported fire ant]], which can kill the lizard in under a minute."[http://www.livescience.com/animals/090126-lizards-ants.html Lizards' Dance Avoids Deadly Ants]". LiveScience. 26 January 2009. ==Mating== [[File:EasternFenceLizard Egg.png|left|thumb|Eastern fence lizard egg]] Eastern fence lizards mate in spring, and lay three to 16 eggs in late spring or early summer. The young hatch in summer and fall. == References == *{{EMBL species|genus=Sceloporus|species=undulatus}} {{reflist}} {{commons|Sceloporus undulatus}} ==External links== *[http://www.herpsofnc.org/herps_of_NC/lizards/Sceund/Sce_und.html Pictures and resource information on the eastern fence lizards] *[http://www.repticzone.com/caresheets/1021.html Care sheet for pet owners of the eastern fence lizard] {{DEFAULTSORT:Fence lizard, Eastern}} [[Category:Phrynosomatids|Eastern fence lizard]] [[Category:Reptiles of the United States]] [[Category:Reptiles of Mexico]] [[Category:Fauna of Northern Mexico]] [[Category:Fauna of the Eastern United States]]

title: Selleys
content:
'''Selleys''' is an [[Australian]] company which produces household [[DIY]] and cleaning products as well as adhesives and sealants for the trade market. It is widely known for recent products such as Selleys Liquid Nails, Selleys No More Gaps and Selleys All Clear. Selleys Metallic Cement and Selleys UniFix preceded these products.  Many of their products are sold throughout [[Asia]] and have become extremely popular in households Australia-wide due to their durability and availability.

== History ==
Martin Selley established the Selleys Chemical Company after he left Germany for Australia in 1939. He had a formula for wood Putty which he and his wife mixed up in the laundry sink and sold to hardware stores and glaziers. He then launched two more products, Selleys Metallic Cement, and Selleys Unifix, which are still available today, as is the Wood Putty. The huge success of the company was slow to arrive, but as DIY became more popular, the Selleys product range expanded to meet demands, and eventually Selleys were selling adhesives, sealants and much more, and the Selley's slogan, "If it's Selleys, it works," ( which was conceived in the lounge room of Doug Stewart at 45 Goodwin Tce. Moorooka, Brisbane) became recognised by most people.Doug Stewart (Chief Consultant and Rep for Selleys in Queensland from 1959 to 1977) was sent to Sydney to oversee the use of Selleys Unifix to secure the tiles on the Sails of the Sydney Opera House during construction.

Selleys is now a subsidiary of [[Dulux]]Group, an Australian listed company on the S&P/ASX 200.

==External links==
* [http://www.selleys.com.au/ Selleys]
* [http://www.duluxgroup.com.au/ DuluxGroup]

Cedar Crest (Gladwyne, Pennsylvania)
content:
{{distinguish|Dolobran (Haverford, Pennsylvania)}} {{Geobox |building |category = historic district contributing property | image = | image_caption = | country = United States | country_flag = 1 | state = Pennsylvania | state_flag = 1 | region_type = County | region = [[Montgomery County, Pennsylvania|Montgomery]] | district_type = | district = [[Mill Creek Historic District (Bryn Mawr and Gladwyne, Pennsylvania)|Mill Creek Historic District]] | district1 = | district2 = | range_type = | range = | range_note = | location = 1543 Monk Road, [[Gladwyne, Pennsylvania|Gladwyne]] | lat_d = 40 | lat_m = 02.72 | lat_s = | lat_NS = N | long_d = 75 | long_m = 15.83 | long_s = | long_EW = W | prominence_imperial = | prominence_note = | elevation_imperial = | elevation_round = 1 | elevation_note = | area_unit = acre | area_imperial = 67.5 | area_round = 1 | area_note = | area1_imperial = | area1_type = | length_imperial = | length_orientation = | width_imperial = | width_orientation = | highest = | highest_note = | highest_elevation_imperial = | highest_elevation_note = | highest_location = | highest_lat_d = | highest_lat_m = | highest_lat_s = | highest_lat_NS = | highest_long_d = | highest_long_m = | highest_long_s = | highest_long_EW = | established_type = Style
Architect
Builder

Completed | established = [[Norman architecture|French-Norman]]
[[Edmund B. Gilchrist]]
John S. Cornell & Sons
1928
1931 | established_note = | management = | owner = Private property | access_type = | access = | code_type = NRHP | code = 96000965 | code_note = {{NRISref|2009a}} | visitation = | visitation_year = | free_type = | free = | free_note = | free1_type = | free1 = | free1_note = | map = Pennsylvania Locator Map.PNG | map_caption = | map_locator = Pennsylvania | map_first = -->| website = [http://www.lindenhillgladwyne.com/ Linden Hill, Gladwyne] }} '''Cedar Crest (Gladwyne, Pennsylvania)''' – originally known as "Dolobran II," and recently as "Linden Hill" – is a [[Norman architecture|French-Norman-style]] mansion and estate at 1543 Monk Road in [[Gladwyne, Pennsylvania]].[http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8368/8590935172_1b56449316_z.jpg Aerial view of Cedar Crest] from Flickr. Located on a hill overlooking the [[Schuylkill River]], it was designed by architect [[Edmund B. Gilchrist]], 1928–31. Best known as the former residence of [[Campbell Soup Company|Campbell's Soup]]-heir John T. Dorrance, Jr., it is a contributing property in the [[Mill Creek Historic District (Bryn Mawr and Gladwyne, Pennsylvania)|Mill Creek Historic District]]. ==Dolobran II== Gilchrist designed the estate for Rodman Ellison Griscom (1870–1944), a Philadelphia stockbroker and son of shipping magnate [[Clement Griscom]]. In the 1880s, the father had built a mansion and estate several miles away called [[Dolobran (Haverford, Pennsylvania)|"Dolobran,"]] and the son named his estate "Dolobran II." ===French Norman=== Interest in [[Norman architecture|French-Norman architecture]] grew in the early 20th century, prompted by American architects who had attended the [[École des Beaux-Arts]] in Paris, and veterans of [[World War I]] who had served in Europe. Its greatest exponent in the Philadelphia area was architect [[George Howe (architect)|George Howe]], whose own mansion, "[[High Hollow]]" (1914–17), is a significant example of the style. The [[Architectural League of New York]] awarded Howe its 1925 Gold Medal for Excellence in Design for the French-Norman manor-and-farm, "Laverock" (1921–28, demolished),[http://www.american-architecture.info/USA/USA-Northeast/NT-033.htm Laverock] from Society of Architectural Historians. in [[Wyndmoor, Pennsylvania]]. But, in an influential review in ''The New Republic'', critic [[Lewis Mumford]] denounced it as "architectural anaesthesia" and "hocus-pocus":
"''The critical weakness of the romantic architect is that he is employed in creating an environment into which people may escape from a sordid workaday world, whereas the real problem of architecture is to remake the workaday world so that people will not wish to escape from it.''"Lewis Mumford, "The Architecture of Escape," ''The New Republic'', vol. 43 (August 12, 1925).
Gilchrist was best known for his [[Cotswold architecture|English-Cotswold-style]] suburban houses in the Philadelphia neighborhood of [[Chestnut Hill, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|Chestnut Hill]]. He had made alterations to the elder Griscom's estate in 1905,[http://www.americanbuildings.org/pab/app/pj_display.cfm/42350 Griscom Residence] from Philadelphia Architects and Buildings. but the son's estate was the most ambitious single residence of his career. Gilchrist's "Dolobran II" can be seen as Howe's "Laverock" on an even grander scale – a late example of architecture as escapist fantasy. ===Description=== The buildings are grouped around two courtyards, 400 feet apart, connected by a cobbled lane. The entrance courtyard is asymmetrical, and its buildings evoke a storybook French village. It is dominated by the corner turret of the caretaker's house, and also features a 10-car garage, a barn with horse stalls, a sheepfold, a staff cottage, and other service buildings. One turns onto the lane and glimpses the manor house through the narrow portal between the main courtyard's twin gatehouses.[http://lowermerionhistory.org/photodb/web/html3/098-1.html Former Dorrance Estate in Gladwyne] from Lower Merion Historical Society. A long greenhouse ran the length of the lane, until it was removed in the 1980s. The main courtyard is a rigidly-symmetrical [[cour d'honneur|"court of honor,"]] with a two-and-a-half-story [[corps de logis|manor house]] to the south, and what seem to be one-and-a-half-story ancillary buildings to the east and west. These are actually wings of the house, connected by curving one-story corridors. The master bedroom wing to the west contains a two-bedroom suite and library, and the service wing to the east contains the kitchen and breakfast room, with servant rooms above. The manor house features three first-floor rooms – the entrance hall, living room and dining room – and three bedrooms above. The gatehouses provide five additional guest bedrooms.Morrison, p. 224. The 67.5-acre grounds include formal gardens, orchards, pastures and woods, two swimming pools, a tennis court, a duck pond, and an [[aviary]] in the form of a turreted tower. The estate was completed in 1931, at a reported cost of $700,000.John M. Groff, "Country Houses of the Main Line, 1870 - 1930," ''Tredyffrin Easttown Historical Society History Quarterly'', vol. 33, no. 1 (January 1995).[http://www.tehistory.org/hqda/html/v33/v33n1p017.html] The Philadelphia Chapter of the [[American Institute of Architects]] awarded Gilchrist its 1929 Gold Medal for Excellence for "Dolobran II."[http://www.americanbuildings.org/pab/app/pj_display.cfm/3405 Griscom Estate.] Hundreds of drawings and photographs of the estate are in the Edmund Beaman Gilchrist Collection at the [[University of Pennsylvania]].[http://www.americanbuildings.org/pab/app/ho_display.cfm/42518 Plans and photographs of Griscom Estate] from Edmund Beaman Gilchrist Collection, Architectural Archives, University of Pennsylvania. A set of blueprints is in the collection of the [[Athenaeum of Philadelphia]].[http://www.philadelphiabuildings.org/pab/app/ho_display.cfm/52958 Griscom Estate] ==Cedar Crest== John T. Dorrance, Jr. (1919–1989) – son of the inventor of [[Soup#Canned|condensed soup]], and chairman of the board of directors of [[Campbell Soup Company]], 1962-84 – bought the estate following Rodman Griscom's death in 1944. He renamed it "Cedar Crest," the name of the farm that had occupied some of the land prior to Griscom's purchase.[http://lowermerionhistory.org/atlascolor/1896/Plate_15.jpg 1896 Altas of Lower Merion Township] from Lower Merion Historical Society. Dorrance filled the buildings with his collection of [[French Impressionism|French Impressionist]] paintings, sculpture, and Chinese and Russian art. His family owned the property for more than fifty years. Dorrance died in 1989, and in 1990 his Estate valued "Cedar Crest" at $10.5 million.Rose DeWolf, [http://articles.philly.com/1990-07-11/news/25898756_1_pnb-campbell-soup-net-value "Dorrance Estate is valued at $196M,"] ''The Philadelphia Daily News'', July 11, 1990. The contents – including paintings by [[Van Gogh]], [[Manet]], [[Degas]] and [[Picasso]] – were valued at over $129 million.Rita Reif, [http://www.nytimes.com/1989/05/10/arts/sotheby-s-to-sell-campbell-soup-heir-s-art.html "Soethby's to sell Campbell's Soup heir's art,"] ''The New York Times'', May 10, 1989. ==Linden Hill== Robert Burch bought the estate in 1999 for $9.3 million.Liz Spikol, [http://www.phillymag.com/realestate/for-sale/gladwynes-phenomenal-linden-hall-goes-on-the-market-for-24-5-million/ "Burch Family puts Linden Hill on the market for $24.5M in time for U.S. Open,"] Philadelphia Magazine Online, June 11, 2013. He changed its name to "Linden Hill." In June 2013, he offered the buildings on 50.5 acres for sale, asking $24.5 million.Robert Bear, [http://curbed.com/archives/2013/06/12/normanstyle-estate-once-owned-by-soup-baron-asks-245m.php "Norman-style estate, once owned by soup heir, asks $24.5M,"] Curbed Philly, June 12, 2013. The other 17 acres are being sold as a separate parcel. The property was delisted in December 2013, and relisted in May 2015 with Kurfiss Sotheby's International Realty for $19.5 million.[http://www.realtor.com/realestateandhomes-detail/1543-Monk-Rd_Gladwyne_PA_19035_M47868-77398 1543 Monk Rd., Gladwyne, PA 19035,] from realtor.com. ==References== {{reflist|33em}} ===Sources=== *William Morrison, "Cedar Crest," ''The Main Line: Country Houses of Philadelphia's Storied Suburb, 1870 - 1930'' (New York: Acanthus Press, 2002), pp. 221–26. ==External links== *[http://lowermerionhistory.org/buildings/image-building-list.php?building_id=1889 Photos of 1543 Monk Road] from Lower Merion Historical Society *[http://www.americanbuildings.org/pab/app/pj_display.cfm/3405 Griscom Estate] from Philadelphia Architects and Buildings *[http://lisaweber.featuredwebsite.com/listings.asp?listing_id=1161650580 Listing: 1543 Monk Road, Gladwyne, PA 19035,] from Kurfiss Sotheby's International Realty *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bDgeKJIuK1o Video tour: 1543 Monk Rd, Gladwyne, PA 19035,] from YouTube [[Category:Houses completed in 1931]] [[Category:Lower Merion Township, Montgomery County, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Houses in Montgomery County, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Pennsylvania Main Line]] [[Category:Neo-Norman architecture in the United States]]

content: {{Film|British-task-force=yes |class=stub |Canadian-task-force=yes}} == Blacklisted Links Found on the Main Page == Cyberbot II has detected that page contains external links that have either been globally or locally blacklisted. Links tend to be blacklisted because they have a history of being spammed, or are highly innappropriate for Wikipedia. This, however, doesn't necessaryily mean it's spam, or not a good link. If the link is a good link, you may wish to request whitelisting by going to the [[MediaWiki talk:Spam-whitelist|request page for whitelisting]]. If you feel the link being caught by the blacklist is a false positive, or no longer needed on the blacklist, you may request the regex be removed or altered at the [[MediaWiki talk:Spam-blacklist|blacklist request page]]. If the link is blacklisted globally and you feel the above applies you may request to whitelist it using the before mentioned request page, or request it's removal, or alteration, at the [[meta:Talk:Spam Blacklist|request page on meta]]. When requesting whitelisting, be sure to supply the link to be whitelisted and wrap the link in nowiki tags. The whitelisting process can take its time so once a request has been filled out, you may set the invisible parameter on the tag to true. Please be aware that the bot will replace removed tags, and will remove misplaced tags regularly. '''Below is a list of links that were found on the main page:''' *http://www.theclassicalshop.net/mp3samples/CH/CHAN241-1201T01D02.wma *:''Triggered by \btheclassicalshop\.net\b on the local blacklist'' If you would like me to provide more information on the talk page, contact [[User:Cyberpower678]] and ask him to program me with more info. From your friendly hard working bot.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]] [[User talk:Cyberbot II|Notify]]Online 18:39, 8 December 2013 (UTC)

title: User:60secnent/C.crazed
content:
'''C.CRAZED'''''
Cory DeAndre-Christopher Gilmore (born August 29 1983) Soon to be known as C.Crazed alias/stage name is a Hip Hop Artist/Entrepreneur. While his success story has yet to be defined his potential 
and promise is unquestioned.

C.Crazed is the Co-Founder and owner of 60Sec'n Entertainment which serves as a parent LLC to record label 6 Sec Records, Production Company Tha Sec Productions, Film and Media Company 6 Sec Films, & Management Company Tha Sec Management. 60Sec'n Entertainment has produced  8 music compilations and  3 film projects selling over 4000 units in total and over 5000 total YouTube hits.

Born and raised in Kingsborough housing projects in Brooklyn, New York. C.Crazed along with his older brother and sister were taken in by his grandmother and grandfather after drugs broke apart his inmedeant family. C.Crazed attended Boys & Girls High School before spending a year in Delaware Valley Job Corps. He would eventually return home to Brooklyn, New York where he would attend Pacific High School Which he Acquired his High School Diploma.

C.Crazed love for music began at age 11 when he picked up the saxophone and took lessons briefly before finding his home in rap/hip hop music. At age 12 C.Crazed states he wrote his first rhyme which was inspired after hearing Jay z's Reasonable Doubt album. At age 17 C.Crazed recorded his first album entitled Tha Villain and also co-founded 60 Sec'n Entertainment. C.Crazed went on to record several street underground mix tapes/ albums developing a mediocre but strong following including his third project Division 1 that moved over 2000 units via Internet in South Korea. C.Crazed most recent project Tha Loyalty is currently on iTunes and as of today has gotten over 300 downloads.

http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/tha-loyalty/id336999353?i=336999399&ign-mpt=uo%3D4

[http://facebook/tharealccrazed facebook/tharealccrazed]

[http://twitter.com/tharealccrazed twitter.com/tharealccrazed]

title: Peopleton
content:
{{infobox UK place|
| country                  = England
| latitude                 = 52.15196
| longitude                = -2.09177
| official_name            = Peopleton
| population               = 640
| static_image             = [[File:Village Shop and Post Office, Peopleton - geograph.org.uk - 131870.jpg|250px]]
| static_image_caption     = Village shop and post office
| shire_district           = [[Wychavon]] 
| shire_county             = [[Worcestershire]]
| region                   = West Midlands
| civil_parish             = 
| constituency_westminster = [[Mid Worcestershire (UK Parliament constituency)|Mid Worcestershire]]
| postcode_district        = WR10
| postcode_area            = WR
| post_town                = PERSHORE
| dial_code                = 01905
| os_grid_reference        = SO938504
| london_distance          = {{convert|96.5|mi|km}}
}}
'''Peopleton''' is a village and [[civil parish]] in the [[Wychavon]] district of [[Worcestershire]], England. In 2001 the parish had a population of 640, with 245 households.<ref>{{ cite web
 | title = Worcestershire County Council : 2001 Census Worcestershire County Population Report
 | publisher = Worcestershire County Council
 | url =http://worcestershire.whub.org.uk/home/cs-research-census-populationreport.pdf
 | accessdate = 2007-09-05
 | archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20070927003043/http://worcestershire.whub.org.uk/home/cs-research-census-populationreport.pdf
 | archivedate=2007-09-27
}}
</ref>

==Location==

Peopleton is located about {{convert|7|mi|0}} south east of [[Worcester]] and {{convert|3|mi|0}} north of [[Pershore]]. The parish is bounded by Bow Brook to the west, [[Piddle Brook]] to the east and the [[A44 road|A44]] to the south.<ref>{{cite web  | title =  'Parishes: Peopleton', A History of the County of Worcester: volume 4 (1924), pp. 147-150.  | publisher = British History Online | url = http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=42871 |  accessdate = 2007-09-05  }}</ref>

The parish is bounded by the parishes of [[White Ladies Aston]], [[Upton Snodsbury]], [[Naunton Beauchamp]], [[Throckmorton, Worcestershire|Throckmorton]], [[Pinvin]], [[Drakes Broughton| Drakes Broughton & Wadborough]] and Stoulton.

Peopleton is in the Upton Snodsbury [[Wards of the United Kingdom|electoral ward]].

==Amenities==

The village church is dedicated to [[Saint Nicholas]] in the [[Anglican Diocese of Worcester]]. It dates from the 13th century with modifications in the 14th and 19th centuries.

Opposite the church in the centre of the village lies the Crown Inn public house.

In December 2010 the long established village shop and post office became a community shop with a legal structure based on the Plunkett model rules.<ref name="plunkett"/> In February 2011 it was featured on an edition of the [[BBC]] [[Countryfile]] programme focusing on Worcestershire
.<ref name="countryfile"/>  A tea room was opened during celebrations of the first anniversary of the community shop in December 2011.<ref name="tearoom"/>

The village hall & playing fields are on the northern edge of the village.

The village school was closed after the [[Second World War]], and the building is now used as a private residence.<ref name="visuk">{{cite web|url=http://www.visitoruk.com/evesham/peopleton-C592-V26800.html|title=Peopleton|accessdate=2013-06-04}}</ref> The only school in the village is now [[Bowbrook House School]], an independent day school,<ref name="bowbrook"/> situated in a mansion at the south end of the village. This house was previously occupied by parish benefactor Caroline Baroness Norton, and later by the mother of [[Barbara Cartland]]; in the Second World War it was used by [[Morgan Crucible]] to accommodate European Voluntary Workers.<ref name="visuk" />

To the north of Peopleton the track to White Ladies Aston fords Bow Brook at Barrels Bridge.<ref>
{{cite web
 | url=http://www.wetroads.co.uk/worcestershire.htm#peopleton
 | title=Peopleton
 | publisher=wetroads.co.uk
}}
</ref>

After the extensive [[2007 United Kingdom floods#Worcestershire|floods in 2007]] when a quarter of the houses in Peopleton were flooded, Peopleton Parish Council raised money for a drainage system to reduce the effects of any future flooding.<ref>
{{cite web
 | title= Flood protection for deluged Worcestershire village
 | url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/10215655
 | date=2010-06-02
 | publisher=[[BBC]]
}}
</ref>

==Public transport==

A bus service operated by N.N. Cresswell links Peopleton to [[Upton Snodsbury]], [[Pershore]], and [[Drakes Broughton]].

[[Pershore railway station]] is the closest passenger railway station.

==History==

The name Peopleton was originally "Piplinogtune" meaning "Pyppel's farmstead (or estate)".<ref>{{cite book | title = Worcestershire Anglo-Saxon Charter Bounds p.188 | publisher = Boydell & Brewer | url = http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=5soGrhJ665AC&printsec=frontcover#PPA188  }}</ref>

The Worcestershire map in [[John Speed]]'s Theatre of the Empire of Great Britaine refers to Peopleton as
"Pippleton".<ref>
{{cite web
 | url= http://www.lib.cam.ac.uk/deptserv/maps/speed.html
 | title= John Speed proof maps
 | publisher=[[Cambridge University Library]]
 | year=1612
}}</ref>

==Notable residents==
* [[John Days]], [[Worcestershire County Cricket Club|Worcestershire cricketer]] in the 1900s, was born in Peopleton.
* [[Jeremy Paxman]], [[Presenter|television presenter]], was brought up in [[Yorkshire]] and Peopleton.<ref name="paxman" />
* [[John Snow (cricketer)|John Snow]], professional [[cricket]]er in the 1960s and 1970s, was born in Peopleton.
* Giles Turberville (died March 1689), a properous local farmer, left "to the poor of Peopleton 6 shillings and 8 pence" in his Will.

==Notes==
{{Reflist | refs=
  <ref name="paxman">{{
   cite web
   | url=http://www.speakersassociates.com/Jeremy%20Paxman:856.html
   | title=Jeremy Paxman
   | publisher=Speakers Associates
   | accessdate=2011-11-02
  }}</ref>
  <ref name="plunkett">{{
   cite web
   | url=http://www.plunkett.uk.net/shop/peopleton-community-shop
   | title=Peopleton Community Shop
   | publisher=Plunkett Community Shop Network
   | accessdate=2011-11-02
  }}</ref>
  <ref name="countryfile">{{
   cite web
   | url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00z7hc8
   | title=Countryfile 27/02/2011
   | publisher=BBC
   | date=2011-02-27
  }}</ref>
  <ref name="bowbrook">{{
  cite web
   | title = Bowbrook House School
   | url = http://www.bowbrookhouseschool.co.uk/
   | accessdate=2011-11-02
  }}</ref>
  <ref name="tearoom">{{
  cite web
   | title = Peopleton people celebrate community shop anniversary
   | url = http://www.eveshamjournal.co.uk/news/9406958.Peopleton_people_celebrate_community_shop_anniversary/
   | date=2011-12-08
   | publisher=Evesham Journal
  }}</ref>
}}

'''WKLU''' (101.9 [[FM broadcasting|FM]]) is a [[radio station]] licensed to [[Brownsburg, Indiana]], and serving the [[Indianapolis, Indiana|Indianapolis]] metropolitan area. The station is an affiliate of [[K-LOVE]].

== History ==

WKLU was signed on the air in [[1992 in radio|1992]] as '''WQFE''', utilizing an approximately 300' tower, located in Hendricks County.

In September [[1994 in radio|1994]], WQFE aired an [[oldies]] format. In [[1999 in radio|1999]], the call letters were changed to WKLU, and the format evolved to a loose variant of [[classic rock]] - specializing in songs that most commercial radio stations didn't play, including songs from "[[jam bands]]." In [[2004 in radio|2004]] the Quinns sold the station to a [[Miami, Florida|Miami]] radio entrepreneur, Russ Oasis, who moved the tower to its current location and reformatted the station to a more commercially viable [[classic hits]] format. At midnight on December 4, 2007,  WKLU flipped to an oldies format based on the hits of the 60s and 70s.

On July 15, 2009; WKLU was sold by Russ Oasis (the stations former owner) to [[Educational Media Foundation]] and the station switched to [[K-LOVE]] ([[Contemporary Christian music|Contemporary Christian]]) on September 15, 2009. While the K-LOVE format is national, the station broadcasts public affairs programming for Brownsburg and Hendricks County on select Sunday nights. In addition, the WKLU studios are used for the K-LOVE morning show which is heard nationwide.

Hi, I'm about to undo your edit and thought I should explain why. Unfortunately not all textbook authors have yet caught up with the newer information.  Regards, [[User:Looie496|Looie496]] ([[User talk:Looie496|talk]]) 01:47, 21 April 2012 (UTC)

title: User talk:Sykestheband
content:
The article [[:Sykes (band)]] has been speedily deleted from Wikipedia. This was done because the article seemed to be about a person, group of people, band, club, company, or web content, but it did not indicate how or why the subject is notable, that is, why an article about that subject should be included in Wikipedia. Under the [[WP:CSD#Articles|criteria for speedy deletion]], articles that do not assert notability may be deleted at any time. If you can indicate why the subject is really notable, you are free to re-create the article, making sure to [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|cite]] any [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable sources]].

Please [[Wikipedia:Notability|see the guidelines for what is generally accepted as notable]], and for specific types of articles, you may want to check out our criteria [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|for biographies]], [[WP:WEB|for web sites]], [[WP:MUSIC|for musicians]], or [[WP:CORP|for companies]]. Feel free to leave a note on my talk page if you have any questions about this.<!-- Template:Nn-warn-deletion -->  [[User:NawlinWiki|NawlinWiki]] 17:03, 31 July 2007 (UTC)

[[File:AFC-Logo_Decline.svg|50px|left]]Your recent article submission to [[WP:AFC|Articles for Creation]] has been reviewed! Unfortunately, it has not been accepted at this time.
Please read the comments left by the reviewer on your submission. You are encouraged to edit the submission to address the issues raised and resubmit when they have been resolved.
* If you would like to continue working on the submission, you can find it at [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/InSelfies]]. * To edit the submission, click on the "Edit" tab at the top of the window. * If you need any assistance, you can ask for help at the [//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:WikiProject_Articles_for_creation/Help_desk&action=edit§ion=new '''Articles for creation help desk'''], or on the [//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Libby_norman&action=edit§ion=new reviewer's talk page].
'''Thank you for your
contributions to Wikipedia!'''
:* '''Please remember to [[Help:Wikilink|link]] to the submission!''' * You can also get [http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=#wikipedia-en-help real-time chat help from experienced editors]. [[User:Libby norman|Libby norman]] ([[User talk:Libby norman|talk]]) 17:12, 18 April 2014 (UTC)
{{Wikipedia:Teahouse/Invitation | sign = | message= I noticed your article was declined at Articles for Creation, and that can be disappointing. If you are wondering or curious about why your article submission was declined please post a question at the '''[[Wikipedia:WikiProject Articles for creation/Help desk|Articles for creation help desk]]'''. If you have any other questions about your editing experience, we'd love to help you at the '''[[Wikipedia:Teahouse|Teahouse]]''', a friendly space on Wikipedia where experienced editors lend a hand to help new editors like yourself! See you there! }} {{#ifeq:{{NAMESPACE}}|{{ns:3}}|[[Category:Wikipedians who have received a Teahouse invitation through AfC]]}} ==[[Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/InSelfies]] concern== Hi there, I'm [[User:HasteurBot|HasteurBot]]. I just wanted to let you know that [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/InSelfies]], a page you created, has not been edited in 6 months. The Articles for Creation space is not an indefinite storage location for content that is not appropriate for articlespace. If your submission is not edited soon, it could be nominated for deletion. If you would like to attempt to save it, you will need to improve it. You may request [[WP:USERFY|Userfication]] of the content if it meets requirements. If the deletion has already occured, instructions on how you may be able to retrieve it are available at [[WP:REFUND/G13]]. Thank you for your attention. [[User:HasteurBot|HasteurBot]] ([[User talk:HasteurBot|talk]]) 01:32, 27 October 2014 (UTC) ==Your draft article, [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/InSelfies]]== [[File:Information icon4.svg|48px|left|alt=|link=]] Hello Inselfies. It has been over six months since you last edited your [[WP:AFC]] draft article submission, entitled "[[Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/InSelfies|InSelfies]]". The page will shortly be deleted. If you plan on editing the page to address the issues raised when it was declined and resubmit it, simply {{edit|Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/InSelfies|edit the submission}} and remove the {{tlc|db-afc}} or {{tlc|db-g13}} code. Please note that Articles for Creation is not for indefinite hosting of material deemed unsuitable for the encyclopedia [[WP:mainspace|mainspace]]. If your submission has already been deleted by the time you get there, and you want to retrieve it, copy this code: {{subst:Refund/G13|Wikipedia talk:Articles for creation/InSelfies}}, paste it in the edit box at [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Requests_for_undeletion&action=edit§ion=new this link], click "Save page", and an administrator will in most cases undelete the submission. Thanks for your submission to Wikipedia, and happy editing. [[User:HasteurBot|HasteurBot]] ([[User talk:HasteurBot|talk]]) 02:01, 29 November 2014 (UTC)

title: Lauritz Falk
content:
{{Infobox person |image = Lauritz Falk-PAN.jpg |imagesize = 180px | name = Lauritz Falk | birth_date = {{Birth date|1909|11|15|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Brussels]], [[Belgium]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1990|2|1|1909|11|15|df=y}} | death_place = [[Stockholm]], [[Sweden]] | othername = | occupation = [[Actor]]
[[Film director]] | yearsactive = [[1923 in film|1923]]–[[1989 in film|1989]] }} '''Lauritz Falk''' (15 November 1909 – 1 February 1990) was a [[cinema of Sweden|Swedish]] [[actor]], [[film director]], singer and painter. He appeared in about 60 roles in films and TV between [[1923 in film|1923]] and [[1989 in film|1989]]. He is the cousin of the Swedish artist [[Bertram Schmiterlöw]]. He was married to [[Vibeke Falk|Vibeke Mowinckel]]. ==Selected filmography== * ''[[Norrtullsligan]]'' (1923) * ''[[To levende og en død (film)|To levende og en død]]'' (1937) * ''[[Det brinner en eld]]'' (1943) * ''[[Kungajakt]]'' (1944) * ''[[Klockan på Rönneberga]]'' (1944) * ''[[Lev farligt]]'' (1944) * ''[[Konsten att älska]]'' (1947) * ''[[The Assignment (1977 film)|The Assignment]]'' (1977) * ''[[Hedebyborna]]'' (1978–82) (TV-series) ==External links== *[http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=14394067 findagrave.com] *[http://www.fandango.com/lauritzfalk/filmography/p125317 fandango.com] {{Persondata |NAME= Falk, Lauritz |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION= [[Actor]], [[Film director]] |DATE OF BIRTH= 1909-11-15 |PLACE OF BIRTH= [[Brussels]], [[Belgium]] |DATE OF DEATH= 1990-2-1 |PLACE OF DEATH= [[Stockholm]], [[Sweden]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Falk, Lauritz}} [[Category:1909 births]] [[Category:1990 deaths]] [[Category:Swedish male film actors]] [[Category:Swedish film directors]] [[Category:20th-century Swedish male actors]] {{Sweden-actor-stub}}

title: Gatra
content:
'''Gatra''' or '''GATRA''' may refer to:
*[[Gatra (magazine)]]
*[[Gatra (music)]]

'''''The Siege''''' is a fantasy novel by [[Troy Denning]], set in the world of the [[Forgotten Realms]], and based on the ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'' role-playing game. It is the second novel in the "Return of the Archwizards" series. It was published in paperback in December 2001.

==Plot summary==
[[Evereska]] defends itself against the [[phaerimm]], as the Chosen of [[Mystra (Forgotten Realms)|Mystra]] fight for their goddess against the [[Shadovar]] and the long-exiled [[Netheril|Netherese]] archwizards try to consolidate their foothold in the [[Prime Material plane]].
 
Meanwhile, the [[Elf (Dungeons & Dragons)|elf]] [[Galaeron Nihmedu]] fights his own shadow for possession of his very being.
